titleStmt.title: James Bindley, Jr. to James R. Page
CWG2262

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Cincinnati Oct 17, 1865
J. R. Page
Dear Sir:

I received your circular, and in answer to same refer you to Hon. Chas Fox Hon George Headly and Hon=B. Stoner. Judges of the Superior Court of Cincinnati, Samuel T. Harris Esq, Alex Todd Esq. M. E. Cannon Esq dean of Faculty Cincti Law College, and Chas H. Fox, Attorney at Law. Cincti and also Chas. U. Fisk of your State. If the references are satisfactory to you on receipt of Commission or a letter from you stating satisfaction of references I will forward to you the fee of ($5)

Comr Deeds
Ohio
Jas Bindley Jr
comd
18th Oct 1865
